Posts.Content: I am now on lupron as radiation is complete. Lupron has same side effects including hot flashes. I find that hot coffee contributed to hot flashes so now I add ice cubes to it. Seems to help Stay strong Gary e
Posts.Title: 24 down, 15 to go

Posts.Content: I am now on lupron as radiation is complete. Lupron has same side effects including hot flashes. I find that hot coffee contributed to hot flashes so now I add ice cubes to it. Seems to help Stay strong Gary e
Posts.Title: 24 down, 15 to go

Posts.Content: So after RAPT over a year ago. Before starting ht and IMRT just recently my psa was 0.16. Halfway thru the treatments my psa is now 0.01. This is great for fast results. So my ? Is how does the psa cancer leave the body. Via the liver or kidney or does it become dormant in the body until it awakens 3 years from now and will become a psa number just when we think it was defeated. Gotta kill this stuff and get rid of it. Not over till its over Gary e
Posts.Title: How does it leave

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Michael F Looks great so far Gary e! The HT likely has a role in this rapid 16 x decline in PSA - which is exactly what is supposed to happen. HT, by some mechanism of action, causes PCa cells to be more susceptible to radiation. I suspect that your #s will continue to decrease to "<" 0.01 ng/ml. May they remain there permanently! How are you feeling so far? MF Thanks for the info mike. Doing rather well with usual hot flashes wondering how low can it go unless a micro psa test is required next time. I hope your word permanent is realistic as previous guys answered my ? About c cells leavingn or just becoming dormant. My take from this is when we get off ht firmagon in my case does the testosterone come back for dormant c cells to feed on and again multiply. Perhaps the doctor can in a way snip the source of testosterone so we can keep low. I guess losing twins down their is better than going thru ht. and IMRT again if needed. : Gary e
Posts.Title: How does it leave

Posts.Content: Been done with RP 2years ago With a Gleason 9 at its removal. Some c escaped into lymph node. psa had dropped to 0.16 before going with firmagon injection and 7 week of radiation. Done with radiation last month but have my 6th monthly firmagon injection coming up. Last months PSA is now (drum roll) please. 0.01 undetectable sayed by the Onc doctor. But now she is determining if this will be my last injection or continue to keep me on it for many more months. She will figure that out. I am beginning to hate firmagon as it makes me tired and gives me hot flashes. I think she is worried, from my 6 week follow up visit with her, is that she does not want the psa to jump to 0.2 or greater. Any one else have a similar experience of whether to maybe say no to the decision if she wants me to continue Happy Easter to all Gary
Posts.Title: Looking for opinion

Posts.Content: Thx rooster22. Cannot say it any simpler than that. But man, for possible life, ugh. So then what is it you take to reduce hot flashes as warm weather will be here soon. Glad radiation is over as it really reversed my incontinence just as I was getting better. Stay strong brother

This means my estrogen is higher and most likely adding to breast size. So my ? Is their a chance of cancer growing in my breast. Would a mammogram be the next step to be cancer free. Any one else done this Continuing with hot flashes Garye
Posts.Title: Embarrassing ?

Posts.Content: Nothing is showing. Just trying to be aware of anything that could develop. But thanks for the heads up. We are all in this together. Stay strong Garye

Djin Is the decipher test color coded to determine the strength / aggressiveness of the cancer? It seems that if the strength could be figured out that would be a neat litmus test for attacking cancer after prostate removal but left over psa of 0.16. That I currently. I will be curious of my next psa # findings next week as I continue with both ht and IMRT treatments. Gary e

Posts.Content: Hi roblee. I was always curious about the AUS. Did you have jitters having it installed the first time. My Uro doc said one Con he fears is that I will not know when to pee which may risk bladder infection. So what is it like if you don't mind telling Thx Gary e
Posts.Title: Incontinence pad experience

Posts.Content: Ugh. 2years after my RP, a year after 7 weeks RT including 6 months of firmagon my PSA finally got down to 0.01 almost undetectable. Then I was put on the 6 month Lupron drug. I am now5 months into it with the 6 months renewal coming in October. I now feel like shit, tired from sleep interruptions of having to get up to pee combined with hot/sweat flashes. Let's say if my blood work in October shows 0.01 undetectable, has anyone skip the next 6 month lupron shot and just hang in their with survalence The reason back then for RT is that the c had escaped the capsule putting me at high risk for the program. If a higher number from blood work comes in then yeah it's time again for lupron. I wonder if those 5 hour energy drinks help overcomes being tired Just trying to make it through Thks if you read this. Gary e
Posts.Title: Should I continue with this stuff

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by RobLee Similar situation here... RP two years ago and RT one year ago. I could have stopped HT after finishing RT last year if I wanted to but elected to stick with it for what has now become the recommended eighteen months. Considering that my Uro who did my RP said I'd probably be on HT for three years, I figure I'm doing okay. And my last 3 PSA's have been undetectable. Of course, the Lupron is still sticking with me. I figure I won't know for sure if the PCa is really gone until a few more years have passed. I sleep well now and rarely get the blues anymore. And the hot flashes are a nuisance but I've learned how to live with them. I figure if I'd dropped out of HT at the one year mark and something came back later on, then I'd probably regret not sticking with it. Yeah will stick with it if the uro and Onc docs say continue. A side from bigger breasts as one of the side effects along with the others I am wondering if cancer can form in the breast. After all our male testasarone is low leaving room for any female component that we may have to dominate our body. I guess feeling for lumps will be in the process. Gary e
Posts.Title: Should I continue with this stuff

Posts.Title: Should I continue with this stuff

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Fairwind YOU decide what treatments you are willing endure..If you cut it short and your cancer returns, you may wish you had stuck with it....I would ask your MO / RO just how much added risk you expose yourself to by stopping the ADT early...That added risk might be small and therefore acceptable to you.. Thx for your reply. Wow, you show a lot of history yourself. I'm curious what HT drug you took. It seemed to go very well with the psa, then you added another drug casodex on top of that. Sad that your psa has jumped quite high to start up chemo. Stay strong from all of us here Gary e

Posts.Content: Yep. My psa is still 0.01> undetectable while also on a year of lupron. The other value of testasarone is a whopping 11. Normal values being 200 to 800. When we are done with lupron then it will be quite a t climb back to normal and get on surveillance Garye

Posts.Content: Whew wee. Good news with today's psa results. Before starting the HT and IMRT treatments I was 0.16. Today it shows 0.01. Uro dr says pretty much undetectable. I will still continue with treatments , more than half way thru now. So am getting close to you guys in the zero club. YEE. HAA Sorry for showing the excitement as we continue to kill the C beast Regards to all Gary e
Posts.Title: Getting close to the club

Posts.Content: Hi. Metformin when used to fight cancer is off label by the FDA. If you are still on zytiga for ht with radiation, isn't that enough for the body to handle. We trust brother, that you are doing okay by adding Metformin. Best to you Gary
Posts.Title: radiation and metformin

Posts.Content: I am 2 months into firmagon. And just under 3weeks with IMRT. I am developing diarrhea problems. Will the Onc doctor prescribe a drug to firm me up. I don't want to be over drugged if possible Gary e
Posts.Title: Lower GI issues

Posts.Content: Gee. Another biopsy. Ugh. I had that done and it is awful How about a full body bone scan where a nuclear substance is injected into. You wait 3hours and then a body scan is taken. I had that done ordered by the radiologist dept to see if I had cancer elsewhere than in my prostate area . maybe others will chime in with ideas Gary e

Posts.Title: One year post Lupron, T = 11

Posts.Content: Trying out a posting. I am post robot op from last year. Still have a 0.14 psa. It all began when I had a psa of 6. 7 of 12 core samples had cancer. My original Gleason score was 7 intermediate. But following the robo surgery I was found to be a lot worse. I became high risk with a G of 9. The surgeon also removed 5 surrounding lymph nodes 1 showed positive and also took out my seminal vessel. I have had c scans of lower back and MRI scans that show no cancer attachments to bone. Docs figure the cancer that escaped is still micro in the pelvic area. The uro doc is getting insurance approval for me to start me on firmagon. Then later most likely radiation. Aren't we a piece of work. I already have had a hip replacement. BTW. The urologist said my psa of 6 fooled them because due to my final outcome the psa should have at least been 20. That is my first post here. Stay strong everyone Gary e
Posts.Title: Newby here

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Michael F Good luck Gary! You have lots of Forum Brothers (FBs) who have undergone Hormone Therapy (HT) and Radiation following prostatectomy. No doubt they will chime in and share their experiences. I would ask the URO Radiologist "Can you pinpoint locate the area(s) of recurrent PCa?" Best wishes to get this 100% behind you. MF Yep, did the MRI yesterday, glad to get thru that tunnel like machine. The radiologist says it is for diagnoses. The follow up will be to schedule a cat scan. To be used for pinpointing the locations of the pelvic area. Supporting the health industry goes on but at least they are available for our use Stay strong everyone Gary
Posts.Title: Newby here

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Gary e Yep, did the MRI yesterday, glad to get thru that tunnel like machine. The radiologist says it is for diagnoses. The follow up will be to schedule a cat scan. To be used for pinpointing the locations of the pelvic area. Supporting the health industry goes on but at least they are available for our use Stay strong everyone Gary The MRI results were negative. I guess it means the cancer is still in the micro stage and has no visible size to it yet. A cat scan is next to map the pelvic area for follow up radiation start up. The firmagon is in me. Get random hot flashes. Gotta stay positive with this next phase of life. Best to all Gary
